alert.note: Alert for Burke; Columbia; McDuffie; Richmond (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 04 at 9:21AM EST until January 04 at 10:15AM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern McDuffie County in east central Georgia... Southern Columbia County in east central Georgia... Burke County in east central Georgia... Richmond County in east central Georgia... Southeastern Edgefield County in central South Carolina... Western Aiken County in central South Carolina... * Until 1015 AM EST. * At 920 AM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Harlem to near Wadley, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. * Locations impacted include... Aiken, North Augusta, Grovetown, Evans, Waynesboro, Martinez, Fort Gordon, Augusta, Clearwater, Belvedere, Hephzibah, Harlem, Jackson, Midville, Glendale, Gough, South Augusta, Midtown, Summerville and Augusta Mall. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in Georgia between mile markers 184 and 201. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 0 and 16. Interstate 520 in Georgia between mile markers 1 and 15. Interstate 520 in South Carolina between mile markers 16 and 23. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM EST for east central Georgia...and central South Carolina. For your protection seek shelter inside a sturdy building and stay away from windows. Report any hail, damaging winds or flooding directly to the Columbia National Weather Service at 803 234 4115 when it is safe to do so. You can also send reports by Facebook or Twitter to NWSColumbia or by e-mail at NWS.Columbia@noaa.gov. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM EST for east central Georgia...and central South Carolina.
